author: dapplion
content:
The random sample on a huge validator set provides a minimal economic security sufficient for wallets and other low TVL features. I would never put funds a bridge _solely_ supported by the altair lightclient, but hybrid models do have value. I don't think making messages slash-able significantly increases the economic security of the feature. So basically:
- low value consumers (wallets) use altair lc as is
- high value consumers (bridges) wait for a full consensus zk circuit

author: dapplion
content: it would be interesting to understand the compute & data cost that you experienced in your implementation and see if we can come up with optimizations to bring them down to a level that would be acceptable

author: sproul
content: One of the issues was computing the LC proof with respect to the parent of the head state, which requires keeping it around. Easy if you've got tree-states, but not so straightforward otherwise.
